title: An update: Did a Brooklyn couple kill a neighbor’s trees for a better view in Maine?
author: New York Times Service
bullets: Stephen Antonson and Kathleen Hackett agreed to a $3,000 settlement for tree poisoning in Rockport, Maine, without admitting guilt.
The Maine Board of Pesticides Control approved the settlement, expressing regret they couldn't hold the couple more accountable.
Ruth Graham's son suggested the couple donate to Maine coastal preservation, but Antonson did not address this proposal.

title: 10 combine standouts that could make sense for Patriots to select in April’s NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Texas A&M wide receiver KC Concepcion showcased strong route-running at the NFL Combine, enhancing his first-round draft potential.
Edge rushers Dani Dennis-Sutton and Malachi Lawrence joined exclusive athletic territory, both projected as Day 2 draft picks.
Vanderbilt's tight end Eli Stowers set a broad jump record and is considered a potential first or second-round Patriots target.

title: Insider: Patriots probably won’t make a ‘Micah Parsons-type’ trade this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are unlikely to trade major draft capital for a star player this offseason, according to ESPN's Mike Reiss.
The team has shown interest in players like A.J. Brown and Maxx Crosby but acquiring them requires substantial draft picks.
Patriots have $40 million in cap space but plan to build through the draft, with 11 picks mostly in later rounds.

title: Largest energy storage facility statewide gets approved for construction in Everett
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jupiter Power received state approval to build Massachusetts' largest battery energy storage system at a former ExxonMobil site in Everett.
The 816 lithium-ion battery enclosures will span 16.5 of the 20.75-acre site and integrate with Eversource's Mystic Substation.
Part of Everett's "Docklands" development, the project includes future phases with extensive lab, retail, and residential space.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Connor Storrie hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Connor Storrie hosted 'SNL' on Feb. 28, 2026, alongside musical guest Mumford & Sons.
Storrie and 'Heated Rivalry' co-star Hudson Williams introduced the musical guest during the episode.
US Olympic hockey team members, including Megan Keller and Hilary Knight, appeared with their gold medals.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s loss against the Red Bulls
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution lost 1-0 to the New York Red Bulls with a goal scored by 17-year-old Julian Hall.
Revolution struggled against Red Bulls' press, having only 27% possession in the first half and limited attacking impact.
Despite generating some second-half opportunities, the Revolution failed to capitalize and have now lost their first two games.

title: Triston Casas reportedly unlikely to be ready by Opening Day, while Kutter Crawford, Patrick Sandoval take step forward in rehab
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Triston Casas, recovering from a torn patellar tendon, is unlikely to be ready for Red Sox Opening Day.
Kutter Crawford and Patrick Sandoval threw live batting practice, progressing in their rehab ahead of Opening Day.
Casas, Crawford, and Sandoval face uncertain roles on the roster due to recent team acquisitions and competition.

title: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce illegal passing laws
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Chicopee installs security cameras on school buses to enforce laws against illegally passing stopped buses.
The cameras, in partnership with BusPatrol, activate when bus stop arms are extended, capturing violations.
The program, legal under a 2025 bill, is cost-free for the city and designed to protect student safety.

title: Review and setlist: Chris Stapleton brings the blues to Mohegan Sun Arena
author: Chris Stevens
bullets: Chris Stapleton performed a sold-out show at Mohegan Sun Arena, featuring blues, ballads, and a stripped-down set.
The concert's setlist included tracks like 'Bad As I Used To Be,' 'Tennessee Whiskey,' and a surprise 'Free Bird' cover.
Stapleton's eight-piece band featured notable musicians, including pedal steel player Paul Franklin and keyboardist Lee Pardini.

title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Stefon Diggs could be cut to save New England $16.8 million, despite being a key target for Drake Maye.
Christian Elliss is a potential cut candidate, with $6.25 million in cap savings, after a modest 2025 season.
Mack Hollins, DeMario Douglas, and Kayshon Boutte face uncertain futures, with possible cuts saving New England up to $4 million each.
